title: Chaos Named

dialogue.speaker: Janaff
dialogue.line: As far as I can see and Ulki can hear, it seems we're the only ones left.

dialogue.speaker: Tibarn
dialogue.line: Strange. I guess only the strongest of us didn't wind up as statues.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: Anyone who was in the building with us was safe, too. But everyone else was petrified...
Wow! There are quite a few more of you flesh creatures left than I imagined.
That's good. Maybe that means we'll stand a chance against her.

dialogue.speaker: Sothe
dialogue.line: Micaiah? Are you feeling all right?
I'm not Micaiah! How many times do I have to tell you that?!

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: If you're not Micaiah, then who are you?

dialogue.speaker: Yune
dialogue.line: I'm Yune. Pleased to meet you!

dialogue.speaker: Sothe
dialogue.line: Yune?! What did you do to Micaiah?!

dialogue.speaker: Yune
dialogue.line: Micaiah is here with me now. She knows that you'll never save the petrified ones without me. So, she let me use her body to talk to you.

dialogue.speaker: Tibarn
dialogue.line: All right. Let me ask you this, Yune. If you don't have a body of your own, what the heck are you?

dialogue.speaker: Yune
dialogue.line: I've been asleep inside the medallion for a long, long time. Longer than any of you can imagine. But the galdr woke me up.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: Lehran's Medallion? Are you the dark god who was sealed inside it?

dialogue.speaker: Yune
dialogue.line: Hmmm..."dark god." "Dark god"... No, I'm pretty sure I'm not one of those. I am neither holy nor base, neither angel nor devil. I am...freedom. Chaos. Transformation. Future. Mystery. I am Yune.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: I don't care what you're called. Was it you who turned everyone into stone?

dialogue.speaker: Yune
dialogue.line: No, that wasn't me. I haven't done much of anything. I just woke up, so I don't have that kind of power just yet. That was Ashera's doing. It was her judgment upon this world.

dialogue.speaker: Sanaki
dialogue.line: Nonsense! Holy Ashera would never harm us! She protects us at all times and guides us toward the right path.

dialogue.speaker: Yune
dialogue.line: You've got it all wrong, little meatling. Ashera is neither kind nor loving to the beings of this world. Neither is she holy nor base, angel nor devil. She is...restriction. Order. Stability. Past. Certainty. Restraint. She is Ashera.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: I don't understand... Why would the goddess Ashera try to destroy us? If anyone's going to kill us all, shouldn't it be you, the dark god who was sealed inside the medallion?

dialogue.speaker: Yune
dialogue.line: You called me a dark god again! How would you like it if I called you a dark bag of organs? I don't want to talk to you anymore!

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: What?

dialogue.speaker: Yune
dialogue.line: Instead...I'll talk to...you. Yes! You're the one I'll talk to!

dialogue.speaker: Mist
dialogue.line: Me?

dialogue.speaker: Yune
dialogue.line: Ashera has always hated me, but I like her. You've got some of her in you. So, I'll talk to you.

dialogue.speaker: Mist
dialogue.line: Oh, OK... So... You're Yune?

dialogue.speaker: Yune
dialogue.line: That's right. I'm Yune. Ashera is order. I am chaos. We are sisters, but opposite in all things. We're linked to one another, though. When I sleep, Ashera sleeps. When I wake, Ashera wakes.

dialogue.speaker: Mist
dialogue.line: Oh, then you're...a...a goddess? I-I'm so sorry! Please forgive my insolence! I've been talking down to you like you're a little kid!

dialogue.speaker: Yune
dialogue.line: No, no, it's fine. Talk to me however you like. You don't have to stand on ceremony with me.

dialogue.speaker: Mist
dialogue.line: Well... All right. If you insist... So, you were sealed inside the medallion, but now you're inside Micaiah?

dialogue.speaker: Yune
dialogue.line: That's right.

dialogue.speaker: Mist
dialogue.line: ...And the goddess Ashera was the one who turned all the beorc and laguz into stone. Oh! Are you here to tell us how to save them? Wait, I get it! You were the one who spoke to me! You said, "Wake me with the galdr of release, not with the spirit of war."

dialogue.speaker: Yune
dialogue.line: Yes, I did! I'm so glad you understood! You're so very clever! Of course, I was hoping, by sending you that message, I would stop all of this from happening.

dialogue.speaker: Mist
dialogue.line: What do you mean?

dialogue.speaker: Yune
dialogue.line: We're running out of time, so I'll explain quickly. Long, long ago, your ancestors made a promise to Ashera. They promised they would start no wars among all the nations for at least one thousand years. If this promise was broken, then Ashera would destroy the world and try again with a new one. Despite this promise, you bone-cages kept fighting each other. Eventually, war and conflict spread throughout the world. When Ashera woke up, she cast down her judgment upon those who failed to keep her promise.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: I still don't understand. Why would it make a difference whether you were woken up by the galdr or by the spirit of chaos? How were you planning to stop Ashera from passing down her judgment?

dialogue.speaker: Yune
dialogue.line: I'm not talking to you!

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: Oh, by all that's-- Would you stop acting like a child?

dialogue.speaker: Mist
dialogue.line: Please forgive my brother, Yune. We want to save the people who were turned to stone. We need you to tell us how. It did matter that we woke you with the galdr of release, right?

dialogue.speaker: Yune
dialogue.line: First of all, you should understand that, because of our link, waking me is the same as waking Ashera. Now, if Ashera had been awakened by the spirit of chaos, none of us would be standing here right now. By the terms of the promise, she was just supposed to destroy the world. No hesitation, no discussion. But if she was awakened by the galdr of release, she was supposed to consult with me first. She wasn't supposed to pass down her judgment until she heard from me. Ashera went ahead and turned everyone into stone without asking me. That's so unfair! I'll show her, though. I'll turn them all back somehow! The problem is that I can't do this by myself. I need your help. Will you help me?

dialogue.speaker: Mist
dialogue.line: Of course we'll help! It's strange, but I trust you, Yune. And we all want to save the people who got turned to stone!

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: Yes. We'll do whatever it takes.

dialogue.speaker: Skrimir
dialogue.line: That's right! We will allow nothing to stand in our way! We will fight!

dialogue.speaker: Elincia
dialogue.line: It's all so confusing... But we must do everything in our power to save the people.

dialogue.speaker: Sanaki
dialogue.line: ...To be honest, I've spent my life teaching that the goddess Ashera watches over and protects us. This is all a little hard to accept.

dialogue.speaker: Yune
dialogue.line: You don't have to believe me. You could just let her destroy the world...

dialogue.speaker: Sanaki
dialogue.line: No, I will do whatever it takes to save the people who were turned to stone. I will join the others in helping you.

dialogue.speaker: Sothe
dialogue.line: So what you're saying is that we all have to play nice and work together? Just forget about all that's happened?

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: Sothe, open your eyes and look around. There aren't that many people left to fix this mess. If you don't help, we can't do it. Besides, I would think saving the world is something we could all agree on.

dialogue.speaker: Sothe
dialogue.line: You're right, Commander. All of this is the result of our war. I guess there's not much reason for flag-waving on either side. First thing we have to do is...unpetrify everyone. And, well... I, uh... I'm actually kind of relived. At least I don't have to worry about fighting you anymore.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: I wasn't looking forward to that matchup, either.

dialogue.speaker: Yune
dialogue.line: It's settled, then! How should we begin? I know! Let's divide the army into three teams. I'm pretty sure that Ashera is going to notice what we're up to...

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: Dividing us up is smart. It reduces the risk of everyone getting killed at once.

dialogue.speaker: Yune
dialogue.line: We have to hurry. I can feel Ashera's power building.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: It's all over if we get turned to stone, too. All right, everyone, it's up to us!

dialogue.speaker: Yune
dialogue.line: What's your name?

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: I'm Ike.

dialogue.speaker: Yune
dialogue.line: All right, Ike. You won't call me a dark god ever again, will you?

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: Not if you don't like it. Can I call you Yune?

dialogue.speaker: Yune
dialogue.line: I would like that. I guess I forgive you, then. Oh, I know! As a sign of my forgiveness, I'll make sure that you can get to your destination safely. I can't do it for everyone because it's a bit exhausting for me, but... Hold still and close your eyes.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: I'm ready.

dialogue.speaker: Yune
dialogue.line: How do you feel?

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: ...Strong. Like I can take on anyone.

dialogue.speaker: Yune
dialogue.line: Wow, you're very confident for a being that can die! Let's see... You go with this team.

dialogue.speaker: Sothe
dialogue.line: I'm going with you. I'm not leaving your--Micaiah's--side.

dialogue.speaker: Yune
dialogue.line: ...Fine. Micaiah says that's what she wants, too.

dialogue.speaker: Sothe
dialogue.line: Let me talk to her!

dialogue.speaker: Yune
dialogue.line: Not right now. You'll have plenty of time to talk on the road, all right?  Hey, you're with this team over here.

dialogue.speaker: Sothe
dialogue.line: ...Damn it.

dialogue.speaker: Yune
dialogue.line: Each team will take a different route, but your destination is the same. It's the Tower of Guidance that stands in the middle of the land you named Begnion. Go there at once. ...I hope to see you all there. I'll be waiting.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: Waiting? Aren't you coming with us?

dialogue.speaker: Yune
dialogue.line: I'll see you at the tower.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: A bird?

dialogue.speaker: Sothe
dialogue.line: Yune! Then she must be--

dialogue.speaker: Sothe
dialogue.line: Micaiah!

dialogue.speaker: Micaiah
dialogue.line: ...Oh. Hello, Sothe.

dialogue.speaker: Sothe
dialogue.line: You're back! I was so worried.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: Hey, if that bird was Yune...where did she go?

dialogue.speaker: Micaiah
dialogue.line: I don't know where, exactly, but she said she must go look for...something.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: Leaving us by ourselves? What's she thinking?

dialogue.speaker: Tibarn
dialogue.line: At least we know what we have to do. Let's move out for the tower.

dialogue.speaker: Ena
dialogue.line: May I have a moment before we leave? Prince Kurth has requested that I pass these out to the herons.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: Those are sending stones, right?

dialogue.speaker: Ena
dialogue.line: Correct. Fortunately for us, each heron has been assigned to a different team.

dialogue.speaker: Ena
dialogue.line: King Tibarn, would you give this one to Prince Reyson?

dialogue.speaker: Tibarn
dialogue.line: That's ideal. We can each communicate with the other teams using the stones. Good idea.

dialogue.speaker: Ena
dialogue.line: Queen Nailah, please give this one to Prince Rafiel.

dialogue.speaker: Nailah
dialogue.line: I will.

dialogue.speaker: Ena
dialogue.line: And the last one is for Princess Leanne.

dialogue.speaker: Sothe
dialogue.line: She's on my team. I'll give it to her.

dialogue.speaker: Tibarn
dialogue.line: All right, we're ready to go. See you at the tower!

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: Yeah, see you at the tower... Hopefully.

dialogue.speaker: Ranulf
dialogue.line: Ike!

dialogue.speaker: Ranulf
dialogue.line: Since we're on different teams, I need to tell you something before we go. Something important. It's General Zelgius. Next time you see him, Ike, use caution. He's your enemy.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: What do you mean?

dialogue.speaker: Ranulf
dialogue.line: He's the one. He's the Black Knight.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: What?!

dialogue.speaker: Ranulf
dialogue.line: Zelgius is the Black Knight. I became certain of it when we crossed the river.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: It can't be...

dialogue.speaker: Ranulf
dialogue.line: I wasn't going to tell you until I had hard proof, but it looks like we're out of time. Sorry I didn't tell you before.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: General Zelgius is the one who killed my father?

dialogue.speaker: Ranulf
dialogue.line: I doubt that Zelgius has been turned to stone. Be careful, Ike. You might run into him. ...Good luck to you.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: Zelgius... The Black Knight...

opening: Ashera, the Goddess of Order, has awakened. Her righteous fury has turned nearly all of the warring soldiers to stone.
Yune, the Goddess of Chaos, has also awakened. Freed from Lehran's Medallion, she counsels Ike and his companions to split into three groups and make for the Tower of Guidance.

Micaiah is joined by her constant, companion, Sothe. General Skrimir also accompanies her, along with Naesala and Princess Leanne. Apostle Sanaki rounds out the group, traveling with her chief bodyguard, Sigrun, and others.

Micaiah's company decides on a southern route and sets out for Begnion. Save for the sounds of the local wildlife, their path is eerily silent and empty. It's as though they have stepped into a vast and desolate monument to the war.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Sothe! Wake everyone and have them gather at the square! Enemies are on the way!

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: Wha--huh? All right, I'm on it.

intro.speaker: Sigrun
intro.line: Lady Micaiah! Has the enemy arrived already?

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Not yet. But they're coming. I'm sure of it.

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: I can't smell troops or weapons. How can you be certain?

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: I don't know who they are or their exact numbers, but the enemy army is massive!

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: Hmm...

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: l know it sounds strange, but I swear it's true! You must believe me!

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: No one doubts your gift, Micaiah. I will not ignore the words of one who has spoken with the voice of a goddess.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Oh...

intro.speaker: Naesala
intro.line: Micaiah, it looks like you were right. We have guests.

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: Leave them to me! The weak among you should hide, for the battle will be fierce!

intro.speaker: Sigrun
intro.line: Empress Sanaki. We should leave the fighting to General Skrimir. I will take you someplace safe.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: No. I will stay and fight with the others.

intro.speaker: Sigrun
intro.line: With all due respect, Empress, I cannot allow it! What if you are injured?!

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: If Micaiah, an untrained girl from the streets of Daein, is fighting, then I shall stand my ground as well.

intro.speaker: Sigrun
intro.line: Empress...

intro.speaker: Naesala
intro.line: You can't win an argument with royalty. But don't worry about her. I'll look after the apostle.

intro.speaker: Sigrun
intro.line: That is a kind offer, but I must decline. It is the first and most sacred duty of the Holy Knights to protect the apostle.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: It looks like the enemy is about to take this argument out of our hands. They're here.

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: Do you beorc ever stop talking? Take your positions! Now!

intro.speaker: Yuma
intro.line: Here are the minions of the dark god! Go forth, Disciples, and deliver the holy judgment of the goddess! Destroy them!

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: You! All of you. You are all Begnion citizens! I'm so relieved you are all safe.

intro.speaker: Naesala
intro.line: Sanaki, be careful! I don't know that they're going to be pleased to see you.

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: What do you--

intro.speaker: Order
intro.line: Minions of the dark god! We are the Disciples of Order, led by blessed Lord Lekain. We have been charged by the goddess Ashera to cleanse your taint from the world!

intro.speaker: Order
intro.line: Death to the tainted souls! Let none escape!

intro.speaker: Sigrun
intro.line: Empress Sanaki, please stay back. These traitors must have sided with the senate during the coup.

intro.speaker: Order
intro.line: Apostle Sanaki is a fraud! Any apostle who defies the edicts of the goddess is an enemy to the people!

intro.speaker: Sanaki
intro.line: What?! No, I--

intro.speaker: Sigrun
intro.line: Silence, betrayers of the empire! How dare you accuse the empress! Treason can only be punished by death!

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Ahh...

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: What’s wrong, Micaiah? Are you still tired?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: No, I’m fine. The air is nice out here. It’s calm, quiet even. I don’t remember the last time it was this quiet. It’s almost relaxing, isn’t it? I hate to say it, but I feel like the world is back to the way it ought to be, finally. I know that sounds horrible. But that’s how I honestly feel. Like all debts have been settled, and everything is properly arranged.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Hmm. I think I understand what you’re trying to say.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Sothe... I’m scared. I don’t want to get used to this. It’s too comfortable. Like our mother’s come home.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: A mother who’d smother her children in order to protect them.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Hello, Muston. I would like to purchase some weapons.

conversation.speaker: Muston
conversation.line: Ah, Micaiah! Good timing.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: You have something for me, then?

conversation.speaker: Muston
conversation.line: Indeed I do, missy. Look at this!

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: That’s a thunder tome. The most powerful of its kind, too! How did you get it?

conversation.speaker: Muston
conversation.line: That’s a trade secret! But it’s the best thing I ever acquired for sale, and that’s a fact.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: How much are you asking for it?

conversation.speaker: Muston
conversation.line: You want it?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Yes. Yune told me that the goddess Ashera would do everything in her power to stop us. I have no idea what to expect, but I’m certain the battle ahead won’t be easy. We have to be prepared. For anything.

conversation.speaker: Muston
conversation.line: I know. You can have it for free.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: What? But why?

conversation.speaker: Muston
conversation.line: It’s not like we have any other customers. Everyone else has been turned to stone. Listen, Micaiah. I still have hope. We have your goddess and an army of heroes on our side. I believe in you--all of you. You’ll put the world right again, I’m sure of it.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: I believe that, too. Thank you, Muston. With your tome in my hand and your hope in my heart, I’m sure we’ll succeed.

conversation.speaker: Muston
conversation.line: Good luck, Maiden of Dawn.

conversation.speaker: Skrimir
conversation.line: Hmmm... I’m confused.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Is something wrong, General Skrimir?

conversation.speaker: Skrimir
conversation.line: Here, look at this!

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: It’s a satori sign. What about it?

conversation.speaker: Skrimir
conversation.line: I found a patch of ground that was emitting light, so I started digging. This was what I found.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Oh, so that’s it...

conversation.speaker: Skrimir
conversation.line: You buried it?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: No, but I saw a vision in a dream. Rays of light fell from the sky, wriggling into the ground and burying themselves.

conversation.speaker: Skrimir
conversation.line: Ah. So maybe there are more?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Yes... I think so. Somewhere...

boss.speaker: Yuma
boss.line: How...could this have happened? How could betrayers of the goddess's word defeat her appointed champions?

boss.speaker: Yuma
boss.line: Death to the false apostle! Show her the punishment for her wicked, deceitful acts!

boss.speaker: Sanaki
boss.line: I...I have not deceived you! I am the true... I am the true apostle...

boss.speaker: Yuma
boss.line: You are the dark god made flesh! The source of all evil!

boss.speaker: Micaiah
boss.line: Don't speak that way about Yune! She is not a dark god!

boss.speaker: Yuma
boss.line: Death to the filthy sub-humans! Despicable, rabid beasts!

boss.speaker: Skrimir
boss.line: Yes! Feed my rage! Make me hate you. Give me reason to crush your bones in my jaws...

boss.speaker: Yuma
boss.line: Black-winged demon, eater of carrion! Prepare to receive the goddess’s judgment!

boss.speaker: Yuma
boss.line: The dark god breeds foul corruption through the words of its false apostle! Her soul is a blackened, withered husk, and we shall banish it from this world!

boss.speaker: Sigrun
boss.line: As long as I draw breath, you will not lay hands on Apostle Sanaki.

boss.speaker: Yuma
boss.line: Traitorous knight of the false apostle! Prepare to be cleansed!

boss.speaker: Tanith
boss.line: Oathbreakers! You are servants of the empire and the apostle! The Holy Knights will teach you the meaning of loyalty.

end.speaker: Skrimir
end.line: Hmph. They were strong...for beorc. Has the senate held back its elite forces?

end.speaker: Sigrun
end.line: No, I knew a few of them by face. Some of these soldiers were new recruits. I can't imagine how they could have fought against us so fiercely.
Simple. They were protected by Ashera.

end.speaker: Yune
end.line: I sent a message to Micaiah about the impending attack, then returned here as fast as I could. Ashera freed the petrified soldiers who would pledge loyalty to her. By themselves, they weren't a threat to skin puppets as strong as you, so she blessed their armor and weapons. Now they are worthy to be her true disciples, and their power will be stronger as we get closer to her. The battle will only get more difficult from here.

end.speaker: Sigrun
end.line: Their weapons and armor are blessed by the goddess herself?

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: Is that similar to the Black Knight's armor, or Ike's sword Ragnell?

end.speaker: Yune
end.line: It's the same idea, yes. The Disciples' blessings were much weaker, because there were a lot of them. Still, it makes them a lot more powerful than they originally were. I'd like to bless you all with protection, too, but I haven't been awake long enough to wield that kind of power. Sorry about that.

end.speaker: Skrimir
end.line: Ahhh...that was how they were able to stand against us.

end.speaker: Yune
end.line: Poor souls... When they were turned back from stone, they probably thought they were the chosen ones or something. No one is good enough for her, though. When she's done using them against us, they'll all be stone creatures again.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Micaiah! There you are!

end.speaker: Yune
end.line: Oh, it's her shadow again! I should go. All right, everyone. I'll see you later. Good luck!

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Micaiah?

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Unh...! What?

end.speaker: Naesala
end.line: Hey, glad to have you back. We should tell the other teams what happened here.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Hm?

end.speaker: Skrimir
end.line: I am going back to sleep. I dislike being awakened so early in the morning. Even if it is for battle.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Yune was here again? I don't like that she keeps taking over your body. She should stick to being that stupid bird.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Please don't say mean things about her. She's like an older sister to me.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Your older sister is a dark god?

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: I finally understand now. Remember the voice that used to warn me about impending danger? That was Yune's voice. I finally realized it this morning. Even as she slept, she watched over us. Yune loves beorc and laguz with all her heart. I can feel it when she speaks through me.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Then why do people call her the dark god?

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: I don't know... But she doesn't like that name. It hurts her when you call her that.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Sorry... I won't call her that again.

end.speaker: Yune
end.line: You mean it? Then I forgive you!

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: ...Hey! Is that you, Yune?

end.speaker: Yune
end.line: "Sorry... I won't call her that again." Why can't you be that nice with me? To be honest, it makes me a little jealous. But that's all right, I guess. I know that Micaiah needs you. That's why I can't let you die. Here, come closer to me.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Hey, what are you doing?

end.speaker: Yune
end.line: Don't be so jumpy. I'm giving you the power to protect Micaiah.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Wow. Amazing... I feel incredible, like I could arm wrestle Skrimir.

end.speaker: Yune
end.line: Good... Always stay by Micaiah's side.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Yune?

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: No, it's me again. Disappointed?

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Never. But I do wish she had at least let me thank her.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: It just would have embarrassed her. You know, you two are very much alike. You're both very stubborn.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: I'm just teasing you, Sothe. Anyway, did you hear what the enemy said before the battle?

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Yeah... They called out Lekain by name. No mistake about it. That means he's still alive, and probably not petrified, since they said he was their leader. I suppose we'll run across him once we get closer to the tower. That'll be our big chance.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Right. We must break the blood pact. No matter what it takes. Of course, our first goal is to save everyone from the goddess's judgment. But we have to break the pact while they're all stone. If we don't, we may save the world, but still lose Daein.

end.speaker: Sigrun
end.line: ...We seem to have missed our chance to speak with her. What a remarkable girl. Lady Micaiah can hear the voice of the goddess Yune and learn of impending danger. She is much like you, Empress Sanaki.

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: ...Let us head back.

end.speaker: Sigrun
end.line: Are you sure? You said before that it was imperative you speak with Lady Micaiah...

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: It's not important. Forget it.

end.speaker: Sigrun
end.line: Empress...

narration: Ike's route leads his group to the west. He is accompanied by his old comrades, deputy commander Titania and master tactician Soren. Also with him are Nailah, Queen of Hatari, the heron prince Rafiel, Prince Kurthnaga of Goldoa, and his loyal subject Ena. Having received a warning from Micaiah about the Disciples of Order, Ike and company stay alert and wary as they cross into Seliora.
